00055 /**
00056  * hash indexer
00057  * 
00058  * @param i - first index
00059  * @param j - second index
00060  * @param length - size of side of array
00061  */
00062 inline int hax(int i, int j, int length)
00063 {
00064     return(i*length+j);
00065 }

00067 /**
00068  * copies one float vector to another
00069  * 
00070  * @param final - destination vector
00071  * @param source - source vector
00072  * @param length - length of data
00073  */
00074 void transfer(double *final, double *source, int length)
00075 {
00076     for (int i=0; i<length; i++)
00077         final[i] = source[i];
00078 }

00080 /**
00081  * cumulative sum of source vector
00082  *
00083  * @param final - destination for cumulative sum
00084  * @param source - source of individual values
00085  * @param length - length of data
00086  */
00087 void cumsum(double *final, double *source, int length)
00088 {
00089     final[0] = source[0];
00090     for (int i=1; i<length; i++)
00091         final[i] = source[i]+final[i-1];
00092 }
00093 
00094 /**
00095  * cumulative sum of source vector using STL
00096  * 
00097  * @param final - destination for cumulative sum
00098  * @param source - source of individual values
00099  * @param length - length of data to sum over [carried over]
00100  */
00101 void vcumsum(vector<double> &final,const vector<double> &source, int length)
00102 {
00103     final.resize(length);
00104     final[0] = source[0];
00105     for (int i=1; i<length; i++)
00106         final[i] = source[i] + final[i-1];
00107 }
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * difference in cumulative sums: i.e. sum from b to a
00111  *
00112  * @param source - vector of cumulative sums
00113  * @param length - length of data
00114  * @param a - larger cumulative point
00115  * @param b - smaller cumulative point
00116  */
00117 double delta(double *source,int length, int a, int b)
00118 {
00119     double tmp;
00120     // difference in cumuldtive sums
00121     tmp = source[a]-source[b];
00122     if (a<b)
00123         tmp = 0;
00124     return(tmp);
00125 }
00126 
00127 /**
00128  * sum up the source array along one axis
00129  *
00130  * @param final - output, marginal sums of array
00131  * @param source - input, all the individual values
00132  * @param length - dimension of array
00133  * @param flag - which margin to sum to
00134  */
00135 void apply_sum(vector<double> &final,const vector<double> &source, int length, int flag)
00136 {
00137     int i,j;
00138     double sum;
00139 
00140     for (i=0; i<length; i++)
00141     {
00142         sum=0;
00143         for (j=0; j<length; j++)
00144         {
00145             if (flag)
00146                 sum += source[hax(i,j,length)];
00147             else
00148                 sum += source[hax(j,i,length)];
00149         }
00150         final[i] = sum;
00151     }
00152 }

00154 /**
00155  * takes a cumulative sum and makes it cumulate from the other end
00156  *
00157  * @param final - output, reverse cumulative sum
00158  * @param source - input, forward direction cumulative sum
00159  * @param length - length of data
00160  */
00161 void reversecumsum(double *final,const double *source, int length)
00162 {
00163     for (int i=0; i<length; i++)
00164         final[i] = source[length-1]-source[i];
00165 }
00166 
00167 /**
00168  * takes a cumulative sum and makes it cumulate from the other end
00169  *
00170  * @param final - output, reverse cumulative sum
00171  * @param source - input, forward direction cumulative sum
00172  * @param length - length of data (not needed for STL)
00173  */
00174 void vreversecumsum(vector<double> &final, const vector<double> &source, int length)
00175 {
00176     double tmp;
00177     final.resize(length);
00178     tmp = source[length-1];
00179     for (int i=0; i<length; i++)
00180         final[i] = tmp-source[i];
00181 }

00183 /**
00184  * takes outer difference of two vectors
00185  * 
00186  * @param final - output matrix
00187  * @param a - input vector
00188  * @param b - input vector
00189  * @param length - length of data
00190  */
00191 void outer_minus(double *final, const double *a,const double *b, int length)
00192 {
00193     int i,j;
00194 
00195     for (i=0; i<length; i++)
00196         for (j=i; j<length; j++)
00197             final[hax(i,j,length)] = a[j]-b[i];
00198 }

00200 /**
00201  * mask out a portion of an array
00202  *
00203  * @param final - array to be masked
00204  * @param length - size of margin of array
00205  * @param val - value to be placed in masked area
00206  */
00207 void mask(double *final, int length, double val)
00208 {
00209     int i,j;
00210     for (i=0; i<length; i++)
00211         for (j=0; j<i; j++)
00212             final[hax(i,j,length)] = val;
00213 }

00271 /**
00272  * inverts 3x3 matrix
00273  * specialty code, avoid calling external routines
00274  *
00275  * @param w - output inverse of matrix
00276  * @param v - input matrix
00277  */
00278 void inversethree(vector<double> &w, vector<double> &v)
00279 {
00280     w.resize(9);
00281     double det;
00282     // v = 9 element matrix 11,12,...33
00283     w[0] = v[4]*v[8]-v[5]*v[7];
00284     w[1] = v[2]*v[7]-v[1]*v[8];
00285     w[2] = v[1]*v[5]-v[2]*v[4];
00286     w[3] = v[5]*v[6]-v[3]*v[8];
00287     w[4] = v[0]*v[8]-v[2]*v[6];
00288     w[5] = v[2]*v[3]-v[0]*v[5];
00289     w[6] = v[3]*v[7]-v[4]*v[6];
00290     w[7] = v[1]*v[6]-v[0]*v[7];
00291     w[8] = v[0]*v[4]-v[1]*v[3];
00292     
00293     det = v[0]*w[0]+v[3]*w[1]+v[6]*w[2];
00294     for (int i=0; i<9; i++)
00295         w[i]/=det;
00296 }

00298 /**
00299  * sum two vectors
00300  *
00301  * @param z - output
00302  * @param a - input
00303  * @param b - input
00304  */
00305 void sumthree(vector<double> &z, vector<double> &a, vector<double> &b)
00306 {
00307     z.resize(a.size());
00308     for (int i=0; i<a.size(); i++)
00309         z[i] = a[i]+b[i];
00310 }

00312 /**
00313  * multiply two 3x3 matrices
00314  *
00315  * @param z - output
00316  * @param a - input 3x3 matrix (as 9 length vector)
00317  * @param b - input 3x3 matrix (as 9 length vector)
00318  */
00319 void timesthree(vector<double> &z, vector<double> &a, vector<double> &b)
00320 {
00321     z.resize(9);
00322     z[0] = a[0]*b[0]+a[1]*b[3]+a[2]*b[6];
00323     z[1] = a[0]*b[1]+a[1]*b[4]+a[2]*b[7];
00324     z[2] = a[0]*b[2]+a[1]*b[5]+a[2]*b[8];
00325     z[3] = a[3]*b[0]+a[4]*b[3]+a[5]*b[6];
00326     z[4] = a[3]*b[1]+a[4]*b[4]+a[5]*b[7];
00327     z[5] = a[3]*b[2]+a[4]*b[5]+a[5]*b[8];
00328     z[6] = a[6]*b[0]+a[7]*b[3]+a[8]*b[6];
00329     z[7] = a[6]*b[1]+a[7]*b[4]+a[8]*b[7];
00330     z[8] = a[6]*b[2]+a[7]*b[5]+a[8]*b[8];
00331 }
00332 
00333 /**
00334  * multiply a 1x3 vector by a 3x3 matrix
00335  *
00336  * @param z - output
00337  * @param a - 3x3 matrix (as 9 length vector)
00338  * @param b - 1x3 vector (as 3 length vector)
00339  */
00340 void timesone(vector<double> &z, vector<double> &a, vector<double> &b)
00341 {
00342     z.resize(3);
00343     z[0] = a[0]*b[0]+a[1]*b[1]+a[2]*b[2];
00344     z[1] = a[3]*b[0]+a[4]*b[1]+a[5]*b[2];
00345     z[2] = a[6]*b[0]+a[7]*b[1]+a[8]*b[2];
00346 }

00349 /**
00350  * bayesian mean - prior + observed
00351  * 
00352  * @param k - prior pseudo-observations
00353  * @param m - prior mean
00354  * @param mm - observed sum of data
00355  * @param n - number of observations
00356  */
00357 double b_mean(double k, double m,double mm, double n)
00358 {
00359     // mean is prior + observed
00360     return (k*m+mm)/(k+n);
00361 }
00362 
00363 /**
00364  * bayesian variance - prior + observed + shift in means
00365  *
00366  * @param v - prior pseudo-observations
00367  * @param pv - prior variance
00368  * @param ddx - sum of squares of observations
00369  * @param cc - sum of observations
00370  * @param nc - number of observations
00371  * @param k - prior pseudo-observations for mean
00372  * @param mcc - observed mean
00373  * @param pm - prior location for mean
00374  */
00375 double b_var(double v, double pv, double ddx, double cc, double nc, double k, double mcc, double pm)
00376 {
00377     double tmp;
00378     // variance is prior
00379     tmp = v*pv;
00380     // plus observed ssq sum(x^2)-sum(x)^2/n
00381     tmp += ddx-cc*cc/(nc+.0001);
00382     // plus change in means squared
00383     tmp += (k/(k+nc))*nc*(mcc-pm)*(mcc-pm);
00384     // divided by effective number of observations
00385     tmp = tmp/(v+nc);
00386     return (tmp);
00387 }
00388 
00389 /**
00390  * gaussian likelihood, in convenient running sums form
00391  *
00392  * @param xcx - sum of squares of observations
00393  * @param lc  - posterior mean
00394  * @param xc - sum of observations
00395  * @param yc - number of observations
00396  * @param dvc - posterior variance
00397  */
00398 double l_posterior(double xcx, double lc, double xc, double yc, double dvc)
00399 {
00400     double tmp;
00401     tmp = (xcx-2*lc*xc+lc*lc*yc)/dvc + yc*log(dvc);
00402     return(tmp);
00403 }
00404 
00405 /**
00406  * gaussian likelihood, for just one piece of data
00407  * 
00408  * @param m - mean
00409  * @param x - observed value
00410  * @param v - variance
00411  */
00412 double l_normal(double m, double x, double v)
00413 {
00414     return ((m-x)*(m-x)/v + log(v));
00415 }
00416 
00417 double l_two_normal(double x, double y, cluster_data &cl, double inflatePRA)
00418 {
00419     double dx,dy,cs,r,z;
00420     double TWOPI = 6.28318531;
00421     double up;
00422 
00423     // increase variance for calls
00424     up = 1 + inflatePRA/cl.k;
00425     
00426     dx = x-cl.m;
00427     dy = y-cl.ym;
00428 
00429     // compute correlation
00430     cs = sqrt(cl.ss*cl.yss);
00431     r = cl.xyss/cs;
00432     
00433     // log-likelihood
00434     z = dx*dx/(up*cl.ss) - 2*r*dx*dy/(up*cs) + dy*dy/(up*cl.yss);
00435     z /= 2*(1-r*r);
00436     z += log(TWOPI*up*cs*sqrt(1-r*r));    
00437     return(z);
00438 }
00439 
00440 /**
00441  * cheap inverse-gamma likelihood, for one piece of data
00442  * 
00443  * @param av - prior expected variance
00444  * @param dv - observed variance
00445  * @param v - pseudo-observations for prior
00446  */
00447 double l_inverse(double av, double dv, double v)
00448 {
00449     return(av/dv + (v+1)*log(dv));
00450 }
00451 
00452 /**
00453  * check if centers too close, return bignum if true
00454  *
00455  * @param a - cluster aa
00456  * @param b - cluster bb
00457  * @param h - cluster ab
00458  * @param shell - minimum distance squared for penalty
00459  */
00460 double fix_shell(double a, double b, double h, double shell)
00461 {
00462     // hard shell between entries
00463     if ((a-h)*(a-h)<shell)
00464         return(100);
00465     if ((h-b)*(h-b)<shell)
00466         return(100);
00467     if ((a-b)*(a-b)<6*shell)
00468         return(100);
00469     return(0);
00470 }
00471 
00472 /**
00473  * prevents hom clusters from approaching midline
00474  * not useful on B chip due to asymmetric probe choice
00475  *
00476  * @param a - cluster aa mean
00477  * @param b - cluster bb mean
00478  * @param h - cluater ab mean
00479  * @param shell - homs can't be closer to center than this or penalty
00480  */
00481 double fix_hom_shell(double a, double b, double h, double shell)
00482 {
00483     // hard shell between homs and midline
00484     double tmp;
00485     tmp = sqrt(shell);
00486     if (a< tmp)
00487         return(100);
00488     if (b> -1*tmp)
00489         return(100);
00490     return(0);
00491 }
00492 
00493 /**
00494  * Given 3 genotype probabilities, make a call/confidence output
00495  * 
00496  * @call - call of final genotype 2,1,0
00497  * @conf - confidence of final genotypes 1-likelihood
00498  * @txd  - relative probability of d = b allele dominant
00499  * @txh  - relative probability of a+b allele
00500  * @txc  - relative probability of c = a allele dominant
00501  */
00502 void make_a_call(affx::GType &call, double &conf, double txd, double txh, double txc)
00503 {
00504     double tmp;
00505 
00506   call = affx::BB;  // 2;
00507   tmp = txc;
00508   if (txh>tmp) {
00509     call = affx::AB; // 1
00510     tmp = txh;
00511   }
00512   if (txd>tmp) {
00513     call = affx::AA; // 0
00514     tmp =txd;    
00515   }
00516   conf = 1-tmp;
00517 }
00518     
00519 /**
00520  *  Given cluster parameters for each genotype, call data as genotypes
00521  *
00522  * @param call - output called genotypes
00523  * @param conf - output confidences for each call
00524  * @param x    - input data in contrast space
00525  * @param length - number of data points
00526  * @param rbma - aa cluster mean
00527  * @param rbva - aa cluster variance
00528  * @param rbmb - bb cluster mean
00529  * @param rbvb - bb cluster variance
00530  * @param rbmh - ab cluster mean
00531  * @param rbvh - ab cluster variance
00532  * @param cn - copy number - are we 1 copy (all homs) or two allowing hets
00533  */
00534 void make_calls(vector<affx::GType> &call,
00535                 vector<double> &conf,
00536                 vector<double> &x,
00537                 int length,
00538                 cluster_data &pa,
00539                 cluster_data &ph,
00540                 cluster_data &pb,
00541                 int cn,
00542                 int freqflag,
00543                 vector<double> &vTxa,
00544                 vector<double> &vTxh,
00545                 vector<double> &vTxb,
00546                 bool store_probabilities
00547     )
00548 {
00549     int i;
00550     double tmp,sm;
00551     double txa,txb,txh;
00552     double lfreqa, lfreqb,lfreqh;
00553 
00554     // precompute modification for frequency of call
00555     // i.e. rare alleles less likely than high frequency alleles
00556     // change this to use frequency instead of precision of mean
00557     lfreqa=0;
00558     lfreqb=0;
00559     lfreqh=0;
00560     if (freqflag)
00561     {
00562         // log frequency
00563         // will be normalized out when computing relative probability
00564         // so no need to adjust here
00565         // also note posterior is always >0 
00566         // note negation later
00567         lfreqa = -log(pa.k);
00568         lfreqb = -log(pb.k);
00569         lfreqh = -log(ph.k);
00570     }
00571 
00572     for (i=0; i<length; i++)
00573     {
00574         txa=l_normal(x[i],pa.m,pa.ss)/2 + lfreqa;
00575         txb=l_normal(x[i],pb.m,pb.ss)/2 + lfreqb;
00576         txh=l_normal(x[i],ph.m,ph.ss)/2 + lfreqh;
00577         tmp = txa;
00578         if (txh<tmp && cn>1)
00579             tmp=txh;
00580         if (txb<tmp)
00581             tmp =txb;
00582         txa = txa-tmp;
00583         txb = txb-tmp;
00584         txh = txh-tmp;
00585         txa = exp(-txa);
00586         txb = exp(-txb);
00587         txh = exp(-txh);
00588         if (cn<2)
00589             txh = 0; // no chance of hets if 1 copy
00590         sm = txa+txb+txh;
00591         txa /= sm;
00592         txb /= sm;
00593         txh /= sm;
00594         make_a_call(call[i],conf[i],txa,txh,txb);
00595         if (store_probabilities) {
00596             vTxa[i]=txa;
00597             vTxh[i]=txh;
00598             vTxb[i]=txb;            
00599         }
00600     }
00601 
00602   // JHG -debug
00603   // printVec("conf",conf);
00604   // printVec("x",x);
00605 }
00606 
00607 //make_two_calls(call,conf,x,y,x.size(),sp.posterior, sp.copynumber,sp.mix);
00608 
00609 /**
00610  *  Given cluster parameters for each genotype, call data as genotypes
00611  *
00612  * @param call - output called genotypes
00613  * @param conf - output confidences for each call
00614  * @param x    - input data in contrast space
00615  * @param length - number of data points
00616  * @param rbma - aa cluster mean
00617  * @param rbva - aa cluster variance
00618  * @param rbmb - bb cluster mean
00619  * @param rbvb - bb cluster variance
00620  * @param rbmh - ab cluster mean
00621  * @param rbvh - ab cluster variance
00622  * @param cn - copy number - are we 1 copy (all homs) or two allowing hets
00623  */
00624 void make_two_calls(vector<affx::GType> &call,
00625                     vector<double> &conf,
00626                     vector<double> &x,
00627                     vector<double> &y,
00628                     int length,
00629                     snp_distribution &p,
00630                     int cn,
00631                     int freqflag,
00632                     double ocean,
00633                     double inflatePRA,
00634                     vector<double> &vTxa,
00635                     vector<double> &vTxh,
00636                     vector<double> &vTxb,
00637                     bool store_probabilities
00638     )
00639 {
00640     int i;
00641     double tmp,sm;
00642     double txa,txb,txh,txt;
00643     double lfreqa, lfreqb,lfreqh, ltot;
00644 
00645 
00646     // precompute modification for frequency of call
00647     // i.e. rare alleles less likely than outliers to high frequency alleles
00648     // Use frequency here, no longer reuse posterior precision of mean
00649     lfreqa=0;
00650     lfreqb=0;
00651     lfreqh=0;
00652     if (freqflag)
00653     {
00654         // log frequency
00655         // also note posterior is always >0 
00656         // f not working?
00657         // note negation later
00658         lfreqa = -log(p.aa.k);
00659         lfreqb = -log(p.bb.k);
00660         lfreqh = -log(p.ab.k);
00661         ltot = log(p.aa.k+p.bb.k+p.ab.k);
00662         lfreqa += ltot;
00663         lfreqb += ltot;
00664         lfreqh += ltot;
00665     }
00666 
00667     // want to maintain absolute scale in case comparing to 'absolute' issues
00668     for (i=0; i<length; i++)
00669     {
00670         txa=l_two_normal(x[i],y[i],p.aa,inflatePRA) + lfreqa;
00671         txb=l_two_normal(x[i],y[i],p.bb,inflatePRA) + lfreqb;
00672         txh=l_two_normal(x[i],y[i],p.ab,inflatePRA) + lfreqh;
00673 
00674         //cout << txa << "\t" << txh << "\t" << txb << endl;
00675         // find the best of three
00676         tmp = txa;
00677         if (txh<tmp && cn>1)
00678             tmp=txh;
00679         if (txb<tmp)
00680             tmp =txb;
00681         txa = txa-tmp;
00682         txb = txb-tmp;
00683         txh = txh-tmp;
00684         txa = exp(-txa);
00685         txb = exp(-txb);
00686         txh = exp(-txh);
00687         txt = ocean*exp(tmp); // how deep is the uniform ocean relative to these guys
00688         //cout << txa << "\t" << txh << "\t" << txb << endl;
00689         if (cn<2)
00690             txh = 0; // no chance of hets if 1 copy
00691         // rescale by ocean to reduce confidence
00692         sm = txa+txb+txh+txt;
00693         txa /= sm;
00694         txb /= sm;
00695         txh /= sm;
00696         
00697         //cout << txa << "\t" << txh << "\t" << txb << endl;
00698         make_a_call(call[i],conf[i],txa,txh,txb);
00699         if (store_probabilities) {
00700             vTxa[i]=txa;
00701             vTxh[i]=txh;
00702             vTxb[i]=txb;
00703         }
00704     }
00705 
00706   // JHG -debug
00707   // printVec("conf",conf);
00708   // printVec("x",x);
00709 }
00710 
00711 /** make utility for comparing pairs */
00712 struct first_less : public binary_function<pair<int,double>,pair<int,double>,bool>
00713 {
00714     bool operator() (const pair<int,double>& x, const pair<int,double>&y) const
00715     {
00716         return(x.first <y.first);
00717     }
00718 };
00719 
00720 /** utility for comparing pairs */
00721 struct second_less : public binary_function<pair<int,double>,pair<int,double>,bool>
00722 {
00723     bool operator()(const pair<int,double>& x,const pair<int,double>&y) const
00724     {
00725         return(x.second<y.second);
00726     }
00727 };    
00728 
00729 /**
00730  * make calls using the final labelings - primarily a matter of unsorting the contrast values
00731  *
00732  * @param call - output called genotypes
00733  * @param conf - confidence of call
00734  * @param x - raw contrast values (unsorted)
00735  * @param length - number of data points
00736  * @param ed - estimated relative probability for d = bb genotype (sorted)
00737  * @param ec - estimated relative probability for c = aa genotype (sorted)
00738  * @param eh - estimated relative probability for h = ab genotype (sorted)
00739  * @param cn - copynumber 1 = homs only, copynumber 2 = hets allowed
00740  */
00741 void make_label_calls(vector<affx::GType> &call, vector<double> &conf, vector<double> &x, 
00742                       int length, vector<double> &ed, vector<double> &ec, vector<double> &eh, int cn)
00743 {
00744     // z = sorted values
00745     // ed, ec, eh = cluster memberships
00746     // x = values to be matched with z
00747     // note: for future work, this should be "bin" compatible
00748 
00749     int i,j;
00750     vector< pair<int,double> > data;
00751 
00752     for (i=0; i<length; i++)
00753     {
00754         pair<int,double> p;
00755         p.first = i;
00756         p.second = x[i];
00757         data.push_back(p);
00758     }
00759 
00760     sort(data.begin(),data.end(),second_less());
00761 
00762     for (i=0; i<length; i++)
00763     {
00764         // for each value in data (sorted x)
00765         // find the corresponding z value
00766         // place the corresponding call/conf for x
00767         j = data[i].first;
00768         if (cn>1)
00769             make_a_call(call[j],conf[j],ec[i],eh[i],ed[i]);    
00770         else
00771             make_a_call(call[j],conf[j],ec[i],0,ed[i]);
00772     }
00773 }
00774 
00775 /**
00776  * assigns the sorted constrast data into "bins" for fast processing
00777  *
00778  * @param zall - the bins of the data, number per bin, sums, sum-squares, hints
00779  * @param z - the raw data, sorted by constrast
00780  * @param zerohints - what are the reference genotypes supplied
00781  * @param zlength - how many values in the data
00782  * @param bins - how many bins at most for the data
00783  * @param hok - can homs be flipped in hints?
00784  */
00785 int setup_bins(binned_data &zall, vector<double> &z, vector<double> &w, vector<int> &zerohints, vector<double> &zeroInbred, int zlength, int bins, int hok, double Cpenalty)
00786 {
00787 
00788     double delta,boundary;
00789     int ti,i;
00790 
00791     delta = (z[zlength-1]-z[0])/(bins+1);
00792 
00793     zall.zz[0] = 0;
00794     zall.zzx[0]= 0;
00795     zall.zy[0] = 0;
00796     zall.zzy[0] = 0;
00797     zall.zxy[0] = 0;
00798     zall.nz[0] = 0;
00799     zall.nod[0] = 0;
00800     zall.noh[0] = 0;    
00801     zall.noc[0] = 0;
00802     ti = 0;
00803     boundary = z[0]-1;
00804     for (i=0; i<zlength; i++)
00805     {
00806         // when do we go to the next thing?
00807         // when a) bins is turned off
00808         // b) when fewer points than bins
00809         // c) when point outside domain
00810         if (z[i]>boundary || bins==0 || zlength<bins)
00811         {
00812             ti++;
00813             boundary = z[i]+delta;
00814             // initialize the new bin
00815             zall.nz[ti] = 0;
00816             zall.zz[ti] = 0;
00817             zall.zzx[ti] = 0;
00818             zall.zy[ti] = 0;
00819             zall.zzy[ti] = 0;
00820             zall.zxy[ti] = 0;
00821             // hints
00822             zall.nod[ti] = 0;    
00823             zall.noh[ti] = 0;
00824             zall.noc[ti] = 0;
00825         }
00826         // add current point to bins
00827         zall.nz[ti]  += 1;
00828         zall.zz[ti]  += z[i];
00829         zall.zzx[ti] += z[i]*z[i];
00830         zall.zy[ti]  += w[i];
00831         zall.zzy[ti] += w[i]*w[i];
00832         zall.zxy[ti] += z[i]*w[i];
00833         // count contradictions
00834         // if no information, no contradictions
00835         if (zerohints[i]==0)
00836         {
00837             if (hok<1)
00838                 zall.nod[ti] +=Cpenalty;
00839             zall.noh[ti] +=Cpenalty;
00840         }
00841         if (zerohints[i]==1)
00842         {
00843             zall.nod[ti] +=Cpenalty;
00844             zall.noc[ti] +=Cpenalty;
00845         }
00846         if (zerohints[i]==2)
00847         {
00848             zall.noh[ti] +=Cpenalty;
00849             if (hok<1)
00850                 zall.noc[ti] +=Cpenalty;
00851         }
00852         // bin ti contains item [i] which has a bias for or against hets by being inbred.
00853         zall.noh[ti] += zeroInbred[i];
00854     }
00855     
00856      // ti indicates last point here
00857     // how much did we actually use
00858     return(ti+1);
00859 }
00860 
00861 /**
00862  * generate sums of data based on weighted cluster membership
00863  * 
00864  * @param n - effective number of data points 
00865  * @param m - effective sum of data points
00866  * @param s - effective sum of squares of data points
00867  * @param zall - binned contrast data for points
00868  * @param wi - weight of bins
00869  * @param ZS - number of bins
00870  */
00871 void compute_binned_cluster(double &n, double &m, double &s, binned_data &zall,
00872          vector<double> &wi, int ZS)
00873 {
00874     n=0;
00875     m=0;
00876     s=0;
00877 
00878     for (int i=0; i<ZS-1; i++)
00879     {
00880         n +=  zall.nz[i+1]*wi[i];
00881         m +=  zall.zz[i+1]*wi[i];
00882         s +=  zall.zzx[i+1]*wi[i];
00883     }
00884 }
00885 
00886 /**
00887  * generate sums of data based on weighted cluster membership
00888  * 
00889  * @param n - effective number of data points 
00890  * @param m - effective sum of data points
00891  * @param s - effective sum of squares of data points
00892  * @param zall - binned contrast data for points
00893  * @param wi - weight of bins
00894  * @param ZS - number of bins
00895  */
00896 void compute_two_binned_cluster(vector<double> &six, binned_data &zall,
00897          vector<double> &wi, int ZS)
00898 {
00899     for (int j=0; j<6; j++)
00900         six[j] = 0;
00901     /*n=0;
00902     m=0;
00903     s=0;
00904     my=0;
00905     sy=0;
00906     xy=0;*/
00907     for (int i=0; i<ZS-1; i++)
00908     {
00909         six[0] +=  zall.nz[i+1]*wi[i];
00910         six[1] +=  zall.zz[i+1]*wi[i];
00911         six[2] +=  zall.zzx[i+1]*wi[i];
00912         six[3] +=  zall.zy[i+1]*wi[i];
00913         six[4] +=  zall.zzy[i+1]*wi[i];
00914         six[5] +=  zall.zxy[i+1]*wi[i];
00915     }
00916 }
00917 
00918 /**
00919  * take probabilities of bins and turn them into probabilities of individual points
00920  *
00921  * @param tex - output per point
00922  * @param length - number of real data points
00923  * @param ex - binned data
00924  * @param nz - number of points per bin
00925  * @param ZS - number of bins
00926  */
00927 void expand_data(vector<double> &tex, int length,vector<double> &ex,vector<double> &nz,int ZS){
00928     int ti,tj,i;
00929     i=0;
00930     // for each bin
00931     for (ti=0; ti<ZS-1; ti++)
00932     {
00933         // for each data point in bin
00934         for (tj=0; tj<floor(nz[ti+1]+.0001); tj++)
00935         {
00936             // expanded value is value for bin
00937             tex[i] = ex[ti];
00938             i++;
00939         }
00940     }
00941 }
00942 
00943 /**
00944  *  convert log-likelihood of all labelings into relative probability
00945  * 
00946  * @param q - matrix to be converted
00947  * @param ZS - edge size of matrix
00948  */
00949 void qtoeq(vector<double> &q, int ZS)
00950 {
00951     double qmin;
00952     int tin;
00953     int i,j;
00954 
00955 // compute minimum of useful values
00956     // so as to rescale log-likelihood to relative levels
00957     qmin = q[0];
00958     for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
00959         for (j=i; j<ZS; j++)
00960         {
00961             tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
00962             if (qmin>q[tin])
00963                 qmin=q[tin];
00964         }
00965     // q, eq
00966     for (i=0; i<q.size(); i++)
00967     {
00968         q[i] = qmin-q[i];
00969         q[i] = exp(q[i]);
00970     }
00971     // mask out useless values
00972     vmask(q,ZS,0);
00973 }
00974 
00975 /**
00976  * turn the overall relative probability of labelings into relative probability of individual genotypes
00977  *
00978  * @param ec - relative probability of c = a allele dominant
00979  * @param eh - relative probability of h = ab allele about equal
00980  * @param ed - relative probability of d = b allele dominant
00981  * @param ZS - marginal size of matrix
00982  * @param q  - matrix of relative probability of labelings
00983  */
00984 void eqtoproblabel(vector<double> &ec, vector<double> &eh, vector<double> &ed, int ZS, vector<double> q)
00985 {
00986     int i;
00987     double total;
00988 
00989     total =0; 
00990     for (i=0; i<q.size(); i++)
00991         total += q[i];
00992     
00993     // get cluster memberships
00994     //  note 0 here is entry "0" in the original list of length l
00995     // entry j is in ec[l] iff j<=l
00996     // so straight cumulative sum
00997     vector<double> eqt;
00998     eqt.resize(ZS);
00999     apply_sum(eqt,q,ZS,0);
01000     vcumsum(ec,eqt,ZS);
01001     // entry i is in ed[l] iff i>l
01002     // do cumsum to get i<=l, then subtract
01003     apply_sum(eqt,q,ZS,1); 
01004     vcumsum(ed,eqt,ZS);
01005     
01006     for (i=0; i<ZS-1; i++)
01007     {
01008         ed[i] = total-ed[i];
01009         // entry i is in eh[l] iff not in a or b
01010         eh[i] = total-ed[i]-ec[i];
01011         // and therefore the sum is always total
01012         //sm     = total;
01013         ed[i] /= total;
01014         ec[i] /= total;
01015         eh[i] /= total;
01016     }
01017 }
01018 
01019 /**
01020  *  setup the matrixes for doing individual BRLMM steps
01021  *
01022  * @param m - prior mean vector
01023  * @param Minv - inverse matrix of covariances (pseudo-observations) for means
01024  * @param Sinv - inverse matrix of variances of observations within genotypes
01025  * @param snp_param - parameters of algorithm
01026  */
01027 void setupBRLMM(vector<double> &m, vector<double> &Minv, vector<double> &Sinv, snp_param &sp)
01028 {
01029             m.assign(3,0);
01030             m[0] = sp.prior.aa.m;
01031             m[1] = sp.prior.ab.m;
01032             m[2] = sp.prior.bb.m;
01033             // only work with Minv
01034             //inversethree(Minv,M);
01035             Minv.assign(9,0);
01036             // set up allowed variation in cluster center
01037             Minv[0] = sp.prior.aa.k/sp.prior.aa.ss;
01038             Minv[4] = sp.prior.ab.k/sp.prior.ab.ss;
01039             Minv[8] = sp.prior.bb.k/sp.prior.bb.ss;
01040             // handle cross-terms here
01041             Minv[1] = sp.prior.xah/sqrt(sp.prior.aa.ss*sp.prior.ab.ss);
01042             Minv[2] = sp.prior.xab/sqrt(sp.prior.aa.ss*sp.prior.bb.ss);
01043             Minv[3] = Minv[1];
01044             Minv[5] = sp.prior.xhb/sqrt(sp.prior.ab.ss*sp.prior.bb.ss);
01045             Minv[6] = Minv[2];
01046             Minv[7] = Minv[5];
01047             // only work with Sinv;
01048             //inversethree(Sinv,S);
01049             Sinv.assign(9,0);
01050             Sinv[0] = 1/sp.prior.aa.ss;
01051             Sinv[4] = 1/sp.prior.ab.ss;
01052             Sinv[8] = 1/sp.prior.bb.ss;
01053 }
01054 
01055 
01056 void force_isotonic(double &mb, double &mh, double &ma, double wb, double wh, double wa,double delta)
01057 {
01058     double gamma, tmp;
01059     // forces means to be isotonic, separated by delta
01060     // moves low weight centers most
01061     gamma = delta*(wb-wa)/(wb+wh+wa);
01062     // shift means towards center of mass by appropriate values
01063     mb += delta-gamma;
01064     mh += 0-gamma;
01065     ma += -1*delta-gamma;
01066     // Pool Adjacent Violators
01067     // possible that mb<=mh<=ma not true
01068     if (mb>mh)
01069     {
01070         tmp = (wb*mb+wh*mh)/(wb+wh);
01071         mb = tmp;
01072         mh = tmp;
01073     }
01074     if (mh>ma)
01075     {
01076         tmp = (wh*mh+wa*ma)/(wh+wa);
01077         mh = tmp;
01078         ma = tmp;
01079         if (mb>mh)
01080         {
01081             tmp = (wb*mb+wh*mh+wa*ma)/(wb+wh+wa);
01082             mb = tmp;
01083             mh = tmp;
01084             ma = tmp;
01085         }
01086     }
01087     // now mb<=mh<=ma is true and average data hasn't changed
01088     // now we make sure that they are separated by delta
01089     mb -= delta-gamma;
01090     mh -= 0-gamma;
01091     ma -= -1*delta-gamma;
01092     // now mb+delta<=mh, mh+delta<ma
01093 }
01094 
01095 void force_IsoHetY(snp_distribution &post, double IsoHetWeight)
01096 {
01097     // ensure that the Y means of clusters are in the right order
01098     // Het mean > Hom mean average
01099     double ystarab, ystar;
01100     double wab,wh,wa,wb;
01101     double delta,deltab,deltaa;
01102     double dxah,dxhb,dxab;
01103     
01104 
01105     // interpolated Y value from hom clusters
01106     dxhb = post.ab.m-post.bb.m;
01107     dxah = post.aa.m-post.ab.m;
01108     dxab = post.aa.m-post.bb.m;
01109     
01110     ystarab = (dxhb*post.aa.ym + dxah*post.bb.ym)/dxab;
01111     if (ystarab>post.ab.ym)
01112     {
01113         wh = post.ab.k*IsoHetWeight;
01114         wa = post.aa.k;
01115         wb = post.bb.k;
01116         wab = wa+wb;
01117         // violation of constraint
01118         ystar = (ystarab*wab+post.ab.ym*wh)/(wab+wh);
01119         post.ab.ym = ystar; // here's where I've moved the het
01120 
01121         // now move homs to make their center work
01122         // on average must move this much
01123         delta = (ystar-ystarab);
01124         // move each by weight of corresponding entity
01125         deltab = delta/((wb*dxhb+wa*dxah)/(wa*dxab));
01126         deltaa = delta/((wb*dxhb+wa*dxah)/(wb*dxab));
01127         post.bb.ym += deltab;
01128         post.aa.ym += deltaa;
01129     }
01130 }
01131 
01132 void bayes_two_variance(cluster_data &post, vector<double> &sixc, cluster_data &prior)
01133 {
01134     post.v = prior.v + sixc[0];
01135 
01136     post.ss = prior.v*prior.ss;  // prior
01137         post.ss += sixc[2]-sixc[1]*sixc[1]/(sixc[0]+0.001); // observed ssq, avoid dividebyzero
01138         post.ss += ((prior.k*sixc[0])/(prior.k+sixc[0])) * (post.m-prior.m)*(post.m-prior.m);  
01139         post.ss /= post.v;
01140 
01141     post.yss = prior.v*prior.yss; // prior
01142     post.yss += sixc[4]-sixc[3]*sixc[3]/(sixc[0]+0.001);
01143     post.yss += ((prior.k*sixc[0])/(prior.k+sixc[0])) * (post.ym-prior.ym)*(post.ym-prior.ym);  
01144     post.yss /= post.v;
01145 
01146     //cout << prior.v*prior.yss << "\t" << sixc[4]-sixc[3]*sixc[3]/(sixc[0]+0.001) << "\t" << ((prior.k*sixc[0])/(prior.k+sixc[0])) * (post.ym-prior.ym)*(post.ym-prior.ym) << endl;
01147 
01148     post.xyss = prior.v*prior.xyss; // prior
01149     post.xyss += sixc[5]-sixc[1]*sixc[3]/(sixc[0]+0.001);
01150     post.xyss += ((prior.k*sixc[0])/(prior.k+sixc[0])) * (post.ym-prior.ym)*(post.m-prior.m);
01151     post.xyss /= post.v;
01152 }
01153 
01154 
01155 
01156 void shrink_cluster_variance(cluster_data &out, cluster_data &a, cluster_data &b, cluster_data &c, double lambda)
01157 {
01158     double main,cross;
01159     
01160     main = 3-2*lambda;
01161     cross = lambda;
01162 
01163     out.ss = (main*a.ss*a.v+cross*b.ss*b.v+cross*c.ss*c.v)/(main*a.v+cross*b.v+cross*c.v);
01164     out.yss = (main*a.yss*a.v+cross*b.yss*b.v+cross*c.yss*c.v)/(main*a.v+cross*b.v+cross*c.v);
01165     out.xyss = sqrt(out.ss*out.yss)*a.xyss/(sqrt(a.ss*a.yss));  // covariance shrinkage, same correlation
01166     // what should degree of confidence in variance be???
01167 }
01168 
01169 void bayes_two_shrink_variance(snp_param &sp)
01170 {
01171     // keep the correlation the same within each cluster
01172     // move the variances towards each other?
01173     // analogue of 1-d common variance
01174     
01175     snp_distribution tmp;
01176     tmp.Copy(sp.posterior);
01177 
01178     shrink_cluster_variance(tmp.aa,sp.posterior.aa,sp.posterior.ab,sp.posterior.bb,sp.lambda);
01179     shrink_cluster_variance(tmp.ab,sp.posterior.ab,sp.posterior.bb,sp.posterior.aa,sp.lambda);
01180     shrink_cluster_variance(tmp.bb,sp.posterior.bb,sp.posterior.aa,sp.posterior.ab,sp.lambda);
01181     
01182     sp.posterior.Copy(tmp); // copy shrunk values
01183 }

01186 {
01187     cout << endl;
01188     
01189     for (int i=0; i<M.Nrows(); i++)
01190     {
01191         for (int j=0; j<M.Ncols(); j++)
01192         {
01193             cout << M.element(i,j) << "\t";
01194         }
01195         cout << endl;
01196     }
01197 }

01199 void Dump_Column(ColumnVector &V)
01200 {
01201     cout << endl;
01202     for (int i=0; i<V.Nrows(); i++)
01203             cout << V.element(i) << "\t";
01204     cout << endl;
01205 }
01206 
01207 void labels_two_posterior(vector<double> &ec, vector<double> &eh, vector<double> &ed, int ZS, binned_data &zall, snp_param &sp)
01208 {
01209     // Means = (K+N)^-1 (K*u+N*X)
01210     // Fix isotonic X dimension means
01211     // K<- K+N
01212     // V1<-V + SSQ + [kn/(k+n)] * (u-Means)^2
01213     // Vshrink = common var    
01214     
01215     vector<double> sixd,sixc,sixh;
01216     sixd.resize(6);
01217     sixc.resize(6);
01218     sixh.resize(6);
01219     // compute basic stats, raw mean/sum-square/number of entries
01220     // for each genotype assignment mixed fraction
01221     compute_two_binned_cluster(sixd,zall,ed,ZS);
01222     compute_two_binned_cluster(sixc,zall,ec,ZS);
01223     compute_two_binned_cluster(sixh,zall,eh,ZS);
01224 
01225     // now we set up the N matrix
01226     // why is this banded in BRLMM?
01227     Matrix N(6,6);
01228       N = 0;
01229       N.element(0,0) = sixc[0];
01230       N.element(1,1) = sixc[0];
01231      N.element(2,2) = sixh[0];
01232       N.element(3,3) = sixh[0];
01233       N.element(4,4) = sixd[0];
01234       N.element(5,5) = sixd[0];
01235 
01236     Matrix K(6,6);
01237     K=0;
01238     K.element(0,0) = sp.prior.aa.k;
01239     K.element(1,1) = sp.prior.aa.k;
01240     K.element(2,2) = sp.prior.ab.k;
01241     K.element(3,3) = sp.prior.ab.k;
01242     K.element(4,4) = sp.prior.bb.k;
01243     K.element(5,5) = sp.prior.bb.k;
01244     // fill in off-diagonal elements for x to x
01245     K.element(0,2) = sp.prior.xah;
01246     K.element(2,0) = sp.prior.xah;
01247     K.element(2,4) = sp.prior.xhb;
01248     K.element(4,2) = sp.prior.xhb;
01249     K.element(0,4) = sp.prior.xab;
01250     K.element(4,0) = sp.prior.xab;
01251     // fill in off diagonal elements for y to y
01252     K.element(1,3) = sp.prior.yah;
01253     K.element(3,1) = sp.prior.yah;
01254     K.element(3,5) = sp.prior.yhb;
01255     K.element(5,3) = sp.prior.yhb;
01256     K.element(1,5) = sp.prior.yab;
01257     K.element(5,1) = sp.prior.yab;
01258 
01259     // temporary!!!
01260     // Need 4x3 covariance pairs
01261 
01262     // left hand side
01263     Matrix Left = K + N;
01264     //Dump_Matrix(Left);
01265     //Dump_Matrix(K);
01266     //Dump_Matrix(N);
01267     Left = Left.i();
01268     //Dump_Matrix(Left);    
01269     
01270     
01271     ColumnVector Mu;
01272     Mu.ReSize(6);
01273     Mu.element(0) = sp.prior.aa.m;
01274     Mu.element(1) = sp.prior.aa.ym;
01275     Mu.element(2) = sp.prior.ab.m;
01276     Mu.element(3) = sp.prior.ab.ym;
01277     Mu.element(4) = sp.prior.bb.m;
01278     Mu.element(5) = sp.prior.bb.ym;
01279     //Dump_Column(Mu);
01280 
01281 
01282     Matrix KMu = K*Mu;
01283     //Dump_Matrix(KMu);
01284     
01285     // premultipy, prevent div/0 in computing mean
01286     
01287     ColumnVector Nv;
01288     Nv.ReSize(6);
01289     Nv.element(0) = sixc[1];
01290     Nv.element(1) = sixc[3];
01291     Nv.element(2) = sixh[1];
01292     Nv.element(3) = sixh[3];
01293     Nv.element(4) = sixd[1];
01294     Nv.element(5) = sixd[3];
01295 
01296     //Dump_Column(Nv);
01297     
01298     Matrix Right = KMu + Nv;
01299 
01300     //Dump_Matrix(Right);
01301 
01302     Matrix Final = Left*Right;
01303 
01304     //Dump_Matrix(Final);
01305     // update means
01306     sp.posterior.aa.m  = Final.element(0,0);
01307     sp.posterior.aa.ym = Final.element(1,0);
01308     sp.posterior.ab.m  = Final.element(2,0);
01309     sp.posterior.ab.ym = Final.element(3,0);
01310     sp.posterior.bb.m  = Final.element(4,0);
01311     sp.posterior.bb.ym = Final.element(5,0); 
01312 
01313     //cout << "Executed through" << endl;
01314 
01315     // update posterior strength
01316     sp.posterior.aa.k = sixc[0] + sp.prior.aa.k;
01317     sp.posterior.ab.k = sixh[0] + sp.prior.ab.k;
01318     sp.posterior.bb.k = sixd[0] + sp.prior.bb.k;
01319 
01320     // update posterior frequency
01321     // Omit currently
01322     
01323     // fix up positions of posterior in contrast dimension
01324     if (sp.hardshell==3)
01325         force_isotonic(sp.posterior.bb.m,sp.posterior.ab.m,sp.posterior.aa.m,sp.posterior.bb.k,sp.posterior.ab.k,sp.posterior.aa.k, sp.shellbarrier);
01326 
01327     // put het above hom average
01328     // this is to avoid unrealistic situations in the face of copy number
01329     // the numerical control is the relative weight of Hets: near zero means move het, near infinity means move hom
01330     // 1.0 means weight hets and homs equally for the final line.
01331     if (sp.IsoHetY>0)
01332         force_IsoHetY(sp.posterior,sp.IsoHetY);
01333 
01334     // now I have the means computed!!!
01335     // on to compute variances
01336     // Technically, these are variances computed from the non-isotonic means
01337     bayes_two_variance(sp.posterior.aa,sixc,sp.prior.aa);
01338     bayes_two_variance(sp.posterior.ab,sixh,sp.prior.ab);
01339     bayes_two_variance(sp.posterior.bb,sixd,sp.prior.bb);
01340     // how do I shrink variances in 2-D correctly?
01341     bayes_two_shrink_variance(sp);
01342     
01343     // cluster covariances in pseudo-obs
01344     sp.posterior.xah = sp.prior.xah;
01345     sp.posterior.xhb = sp.prior.xhb;
01346     sp.posterior.xab = sp.prior.xab;
01347     sp.posterior.yah = sp.prior.yah;
01348     sp.posterior.yhb = sp.prior.yhb;
01349     sp.posterior.yab = sp.prior.yab;
01350 }
01351 
01352 
01353 /**
01354  * convert binned label relative probabilities into cluster parameters
01355  *
01356  * @param ec - relative probability of c = a allele dominates
01357  * @param eh - relative probability of h = ab about equal
01358  * @param ed - relative probability of d = b allele dominates
01359  * @param ZS - length of bins
01360  * @param zall - all binned data, sums, sums of squares
01361  * @param sp - snp parameters
01362  */
01363 void labelstoposterior(vector<double> &ec, vector<double> &eh, vector<double> &ed, int ZS, binned_data &zall, snp_param &sp)
01364 {
01365     // compute posterior mean/variance based on model average labels
01366     double rnd,rnc,rnh,rmd,rmc,rmh,rsd,rsc,rsh;
01367     double rbma,rbmb,rbmh,rbva,rbvb,rbvh;
01368     //double tmp;
01369     
01370     // compute basic stats, raw mean/sum-square/number of entries
01371     // for each genotype assignment mixed fraction
01372     compute_binned_cluster(rnd,rmd,rsd,zall,ed,ZS);
01373     compute_binned_cluster(rnc,rmc,rsc,zall,ec,ZS);
01374     compute_binned_cluster(rnh,rmh,rsh,zall,eh,ZS);
01375 
01376     // Compute the posterior mean/variance
01377     // i.e. do BRLMM step here
01378     //rbmb = b_mean(sp.bb.k,sp.bb.m,rmd,rnd);
01379     //rbma = b_mean(sp.aa.k,sp.aa.m,rmc,rnc);
01380     //rbmh = b_mean(sp.ab.k,sp.ab.m,rmh,rnh);
01381     
01382 // BRLMM
01383 // setup BRLMM
01384             vector<double> m;
01385             vector<double> Minv;
01386             vector<double> Sinv;
01387             setupBRLMM(m,Minv,Sinv,sp);
01388             // only work with Sinv;
01389             // scratch vectors
01390             vector<double> Tz;
01391             vector<double> Zt;
01392             vector<double> Xinv;
01393             vector<double> Xt;
01394             vector<double> Mz;
01395             // vectors that change
01396             // sum of x
01397             vector<double> Nv;
01398             // number of data points
01399             vector<double> N;
01400     // brlmm here
01401             Nv.resize(3);
01402             Nv[0] = rmc;
01403             Nv[1] = rmh;
01404             Nv[2] = rmd;
01405             N.assign(9,0);
01406             N[0] = rnc;
01407             N[4] = rnh;
01408             N[8] = rnd;
01409             timesthree(Tz,N,Sinv);
01410             sumthree(Zt, Minv,Tz);
01411             inversethree(Xinv,Zt);
01412             timesone(Tz,Sinv, Nv);
01413             timesone(Zt,Minv, m);
01414             sumthree(Xt,Tz,Zt);
01415             timesone(Mz,Xinv,Xt);
01416             rbma = Mz[0];
01417             rbmh = Mz[1];
01418             rbmb = Mz[2];
01419     // fix up positions of posterior
01420     if (sp.hardshell==3)
01421         force_isotonic(rbmb,rbmh,rbma,rnd+sp.prior.bb.k,rnh+sp.prior.ab.k,rnd+sp.prior.aa.k, sp.shellbarrier);
01422 
01423     // do within-cluster variance as before
01424     rbvb = b_var(sp.prior.bb.v,sp.prior.bb.ss,rsd,rmd,rnd,sp.prior.bb.k,rbmb,sp.prior.bb.m);
01425     rbva = b_var(sp.prior.aa.v,sp.prior.aa.ss,rsc,rmc,rnc,sp.prior.aa.k,rbma,sp.prior.aa.m);
01426     rbvh = b_var(sp.prior.ab.v,sp.prior.ab.ss,rsh,rmh,rnh,sp.prior.ab.k,rbmh,sp.prior.ab.m);
01427     
01428     // fix up variances if needed
01429     if (sp.comvar==1 )
01430     {
01431             double tc,td,th;
01432             double tnc,tnd,tnh;
01433             double tl,tlm;
01434             tnd = rnd+sp.prior.bb.v;
01435             tnc = rnc+sp.prior.aa.v;
01436             tnh = rnh+sp.prior.ab.v;
01437             td = rbvb*tnd;
01438             tc = rbva*tnc;
01439             th = rbvh*tnh;
01440             // cross-talk between variances 0 = independent, 1 = common variance
01441             tl = sp.lambda;
01442             tlm = 3-2*sp.lambda;
01443             rbvb = (tlm*td+tl*tc+tl*th)/(tlm*tnd+tl*tnc+tl*tnh);
01444             rbva = (tl*td+tlm*tc+tl*th)/(tl*tnd+tlm*tnc+tl*tnh);
01445             rbvh = (tl*td+tl*tc+tlm*th)/(tl*tnd+tl*tnc+tlm*tnh);
01446     }
01447 
01448     // output posterior + estimated fraction of data used for each cluster
01449     sp.posterior.aa.Set(rbma,rbva,rnc+sp.prior.aa.k,rnc+sp.prior.aa.v,sp.prior.aa.ym,sp.prior.aa.yss,sp.prior.aa.xyss);
01450     sp.posterior.ab.Set(rbmh,rbvh,rnh+sp.prior.ab.k,rnh+sp.prior.ab.v,sp.prior.ab.ym,sp.prior.ab.yss,sp.prior.ab.xyss);
01451     sp.posterior.bb.Set(rbmb,rbvb,rnd+sp.prior.bb.k,rnd+sp.prior.bb.v,sp.prior.bb.ym,sp.prior.bb.yss,sp.prior.bb.xyss);
01452     // set up posterior covariances to be prior covariances
01453     // since working with inverse, not actually changed by increased observations
01454     sp.posterior.xah = sp.prior.xah;
01455     sp.posterior.xab = sp.prior.xab;
01456     sp.posterior.xhb = sp.prior.xhb;
01457 }
01458 
01459 
01460 /**
01461  * This penalizes unusual frequency distributions
01462  * 
01463  * @param a - first cluster freq
01464  * @param b - second cluster freq
01465  * @param c - third cluster freq
01466  * @param oa - number of observations
01467  * @param ob - number of observations
01468  * @param oc - number of observations
01469  * @param lambda - parameterized safety value to avoid zero frequency
01470  */
01471 double mixture_penalty(double a,double b, double c,double oa, double ob, double oc,double lambda)
01472 {
01473     double total, entropy;
01474 
01475     // penalty for mixing fraction
01476     // want to avoid splitting clusters
01477     // so 20/0/0 is good, 7/7/7 less good
01478     // i.e. need more evidence to provoke a new cluster
01479     total = a+b+c+3*lambda;
01480     entropy = oa * log((a+lambda)/total)+ob*log((b+lambda)/total)+oc*log((c+lambda)/total);
01481     entropy = -1*entropy;
01482     return(entropy);
01483 }
01484 
01485 /**
01486  * This penalizes unusual cluster distributions (violating HW extremely)
01487  * Expected to be useful for screening/finding initial priors
01488  *
01489  * @param a - hom cluster freq
01490  * @param b - hom cluster freq
01491  * @param c - het cluster freq
01492  */
01493 double HW_penalty(double a, double b, double c, double lambda)
01494 {
01495     double total, penalty, p, q;
01496 
01497     total = 2*a+2*b+2*c+2*lambda; // total number of chromosomes +1 for always potential errors
01498     p = (2*a+c+lambda)/total; // hom chromosomes + het chromosomes belonging to the allele
01499     q = 1-p;              // other hom
01500     // a* log(p*p)+c*log(2*p*q) + b*log(q*q) = (2a+c)*log(p)+(2b+c)*log(q)+c*log(2)
01501     penalty = (2*a+c)*log(p) + (2*b+c)*log(q)+c*log((double)2);
01502     penalty = -1*penalty;
01503     return(penalty);
01504 }
01505 
01506 
01507 /**
01508  * This is the "labeling" routine that tries out all plausible genotypes for best likelihood
01509  * Basic goal: efficiently evaluate likelihood of three clusters based on seed
01510  * Loops over BB,...BB (i times), AB,...AB (j-i), AA,...AA (n-j+1)
01511  *
01512  * @param ec - relative probability of c = a allele dominates
01513  * @param eh - relative probability of h = ab allele similar
01514  * @param ec - relative probability of d = b allele dominates
01515  * @param ZS - number of bins + 1 = size of data
01516  * @param zall - data in bins, sum, sum of squares
01517  * @param sp - snp parameters
01518  */
01519 void integratebrlmmoverlabelings(vector<double> &ec, vector<double> &eh, vector<double> &ed, int ZS, binned_data &zall,snp_param &sp)
01520 {
01521     int ZSS;
01522     int NS;
01523     int i,j;
01524     //double tmp;
01525     // allocate memory for these puppies
01526     // over allocate for most of these, but temporary
01527     ZSS = ZS*ZS;
01528 
01529     // likelihood of data, given 
01530     vector<double> q;
01531     q.resize(ZSS);
01532     q.assign(ZSS,0);
01533     vector<double> ddx;
01534     vector<double> ccx;
01535     vector<double> nd;
01536     vector<double> nc;
01537     vector<double> dd;
01538     vector<double> cc;
01539     ddx.resize(ZS);
01540     ccx.resize(ZS);
01541     nd.resize(ZS);
01542     nc.resize(ZS);
01543     dd.resize(ZS);
01544     cc.resize(ZS);
01545 
01546     vector<double> dnod;
01547     vector<double> dnoh;
01548     vector<double> dnoc,cnoc;
01549     dnod.resize(ZS);
01550     //hnod.resize(ZS);
01551     //cnod.resize(ZS);
01552     dnoh.resize(ZS);
01553     //hnoh.resize(ZS);
01554     //cnoh.resize(ZS);
01555     dnoc.resize(ZS);
01556     //hnoc.resize(ZS);
01557     cnoc.resize(ZS);
01558 
01559     // count up the number of contradictions
01560     // cumulative contradictions
01561     vcumsum(dnod,zall.nod,ZS);
01562     vcumsum(dnoh,zall.noh,ZS);
01563     vcumsum(dnoc,zall.noc,ZS);
01564     //vreversecumsum(cnod,dnod,ZS);
01565     //vreversecumsum(cnoh,dnoh,ZS);
01566     vreversecumsum(cnoc,dnoc,ZS);
01567     // multiply by the penalty to reduce computational load
01568     // obsolete: contradictions are directly penalized in the bins
01569     //vmult(cnoc,sp.contradictionpenalty);
01570     //vmult(dnod,sp.contradictionpenalty);
01571     //vmult(dnoh,sp.contradictionpenalty);
01572 
01573     
01574 
01575     // cumulative number - weight for bins
01576     vcumsum(nd,zall.nz,ZS);
01577     NS = (int)floor(nd[ZS-1]+.00001); // number of points total
01578     vreversecumsum(nc,nd,ZS);
01579     //cumulative sum of values
01580     vcumsum(dd,zall.zz,ZS);
01581     vreversecumsum(cc,dd,ZS);
01582     // cumulative sum squares
01583     vcumsum(ddx,zall.zzx,ZS);
01584     vreversecumsum(ccx,ddx,ZS);
01585 
01586     int tin;
01587 
01588     // temporaries
01589     double ycij,xcij,xcxij;
01590     double ydij,xdij,xdxij;
01591     double yhij,xhij,xhxij;
01592     double ldij,lcij,lhij;
01593     double dvdij,dvcij,dvhij;
01594 
01595     // setup brlmm bits that don't change
01596     // speed
01597             vector<double> m;
01598             vector<double> Minv;
01599             vector<double> Sinv;
01600             setupBRLMM(m,Minv,Sinv,sp);
01601             // only work with Sinv;
01602             // scratch vectors
01603             vector<double> Tz;
01604             vector<double> Zt;
01605             vector<double> Xinv;
01606             vector<double> Xt;
01607             vector<double> Mz;
01608             // vectors that change
01609             // sum of x
01610             vector<double> Nv;
01611             // number of data points
01612             vector<double> N;
01613             Nv.resize(3);
01614             N.assign(9,0);
01615 
01616     // do some more setup
01617     // so that things that aren't executed don't get repeated conditionals
01618     if (sp.copynumber<2)
01619     {
01620         // no hets
01621         for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
01622             for (j=i+1; j<ZS; j++)
01623             {
01624                 tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
01625                 q[tin] += NS*1000;
01626             }
01627     }
01628 
01629     if (sp.hints==1)
01630     {
01631         // penalty for contradiction of reference
01632         for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
01633             for (j=i; j<ZS; j++)
01634             {
01635                 tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
01636                 q[tin] += (dnod[i]+cnoc[j]+(dnoh[j]-dnoh[i]));
01637             }
01638 
01639     }
01640     
01641     if (sp.mix==1)
01642     {
01643         // mixture penalty under observed data
01644         for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
01645             for (j=i; j<ZS; j++)
01646             {
01647                 tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
01648                 q[tin] += mixture_penalty(nc[j],nd[i],nd[j]-nd[i],nc[j],nd[i],nd[j]-nd[i],sp.SafetyFrequency);
01649             }
01650     }
01651     if (sp.mix==2)
01652     {
01653         // mixture penalty under observed+prior number of observations
01654         // change to use frequency not "prior precision"
01655         // make room for better code
01656         // i.e. posterior should be grouped correctly
01657         for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
01658             for (j=i; j<ZS; j++)
01659             {
01660                 tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
01661                 q[tin] += mixture_penalty(nc[j]+sp.prior.aa.k,nd[i]+sp.prior.bb.k,nd[j]-nd[i]+sp.prior.ab.k,nc[j],nd[i],nd[j]-nd[i],sp.SafetyFrequency);
01662             }
01663     }
01664     if (sp.mix==3)
01665     {
01666         for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
01667             for (j=i; j<ZS; j++)
01668             {
01669                 tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
01670                 q[tin] += HW_penalty(nc[j],nd[i],nd[j]-nd[i], 0.5*sp.SafetyFrequency);
01671             }
01672     }
01673     if (sp.bic>0)
01674     {
01675         // if useful to do some bic correction
01676         // bic * log(n) - empirical correction
01677         for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
01678         {
01679             // subtract off once for 2 cluster
01680             // [0,0],[0,ZS-1],[ZS-1,ZS-1] occur twice
01681             // so subtract off 2 times for 1 cluster
01682             tin = hax(i,i,ZS);
01683                     q[tin] -= sp.bic*log((double)NS);
01684             tin = hax(0,i,ZS);
01685             q[tin] -= sp.bic*log((double)NS);
01686             tin = hax(i,ZS-1,ZS);
01687             q[tin] -= sp.bic*log((double)NS);
01688             for (j=i; j<ZS; j++)
01689             {
01690                 tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
01691                 // add 3 times for everyone
01692                 q[tin] += 3*sp.bic*log((double)NS);
01693             }
01694         }
01695     }
01696     // likelihood of data under posterior
01697     // (x-m)^2 = x^2-2*x*m+m^2
01698     // running sums sum(x^2)-2*(sum(x)*m+sum(1)*m^2
01699     // big loop: try all reasonable labelings
01700     // bb^i->ab^(j-i)->aa^(n-j+1)
01701     for (i=0; i<ZS; i++)
01702         for (j=i; j<ZS; j++)
01703         {
01704             tin = hax(i,j,ZS);
01705             // initialize global matrix
01706             // c
01707             ycij = nc[j];
01708             xcij = cc[j];
01709             xcxij = ccx[j];
01710             // d
01711             ydij = nd[i];
01712             xdij = dd[i];
01713             xdxij = ddx[i];
01714             // h
01715             yhij = nd[j]-nd[i];
01716             xhij = dd[j]-dd[i];
01717             xhxij = ddx[j]-ddx[i];
01718 
01719 
01720             // brlmm here
01721             // setup centers
01722             Nv[0] = xcij;
01723             Nv[1] = xhij;
01724             Nv[2] = xdij;
01725             // number of data points
01726             N[0] = ycij;
01727             N[4] = yhij;
01728             N[8] = ydij;
01729             // do some inversions
01730             timesthree(Tz,N,Sinv);
01731             sumthree(Zt, Minv,Tz);
01732             inversethree(Xinv,Zt);
01733             timesone(Tz,Sinv, Nv);
01734             timesone(Zt,Minv, m);
01735             sumthree(Xt,Tz,Zt);
01736             timesone(Mz,Xinv,Xt);
01737             // Tz = three means
01738             //printf("%d %f %f %f\n", tin, Mz[0],Mz[1],Mz[2]);
01739             
01740             
01741             // figure out the triple mean/variance combo
01742             ldij = Mz[2];
01743             lhij = Mz[1];
01744             lcij = Mz[0];
01745             // force means apart by shellbarrier
01746             if (sp.hardshell==3)
01747                 force_isotonic(ldij,lhij,lcij,ydij+sp.prior.bb.k,yhij+sp.prior.ab.k,ydij+sp.prior.aa.k, sp.shellbarrier);
01748             // compute variance given means
01749             // within-cluster variance + prior + distance shifted
01750             dvcij = b_var(sp.prior.aa.v,sp.prior.aa.ss,xcxij,xcij,ycij,sp.prior.aa.k,lcij,sp.prior.aa.m);
01751             dvdij = b_var(sp.prior.bb.v,sp.prior.bb.ss,xdxij,xdij,ydij,sp.prior.bb.k,ldij,sp.prior.bb.m);
01752             dvhij = b_var(sp.prior.ab.v,sp.prior.ab.ss,xhxij,xhij,yhij,sp.prior.ab.k,lhij,sp.prior.ab.m);
01753 
01754             // fix up common variance
01755             if (sp.comvar==1)
01756             {
01757                 double tc,td,th;
01758                 double tnc,tnd,tnh;
01759                 double tl,tlm;
01760                 tnd = ydij+sp.prior.bb.v;
01761                 tnc = ycij+sp.prior.aa.v;
01762                 tnh = yhij+sp.prior.ab.v;
01763                 td = dvdij*tnd;
01764                 tc = dvcij*tnc;
01765                 th = dvhij*tnh;
01766                 // cross-talk between variances 0 = independent, 1 = common variance
01767                 tl = sp.lambda;
01768                 tlm = 3-2*sp.lambda;
01769                 dvdij = (tlm*td+tl*tc+tl*th)/(tlm*tnd+tl*tnc+tl*tnh);
01770                 dvcij = (tl*td+tlm*tc+tl*th)/(tl*tnd+tlm*tnc+tl*tnh);
01771                 dvhij = (tl*td+tl*tc+tlm*th)/(tl*tnd+tl*tnc+tlm*tnh);
01772             }
01773         ////
01774         ////
01775         //// now do the global likelihood with calculated values
01776             // likelihood of the data gvien mean/variance    
01777             //q[tin] = 0;
01778             q[tin] += l_posterior(xdxij,ldij,xdij,ydij,dvdij);
01779             q[tin] += l_posterior(xhxij,lhij,xhij,yhij,dvhij);
01780             q[tin] += l_posterior(xcxij,lcij,xcij,ycij,dvcij);    
01781             //printf("%d %lf\n", i, q[i]);    
01782     
01783             // likelihood of mean under prior
01784             //q[tin] += l_normal(sp.bb.m,ldij,sp.bb.ss/sp.bb.k);
01785             //q[tin] += l_normal(sp.ab.m,lhij,sp.ab.ss/sp.ab.k);
01786             //q[tin] += l_normal(sp.aa.m,lcij,sp.aa.ss/sp.aa.k);
01787             q[tin] += l_normal(sp.prior.bb.m,ldij,1/Minv[8]);
01788             q[tin] += l_normal(sp.prior.ab.m,lhij,1/Minv[4]);
01789             q[tin] += l_normal(sp.prior.aa.m,lcij,1/Minv[0]);
01790             // likelihood of variance under prior
01791             q[tin] += l_inverse(sp.prior.bb.ss,dvdij,sp.prior.bb.v);
01792             q[tin] += l_inverse(sp.prior.ab.ss,dvhij,sp.prior.ab.v);
01793             q[tin] += l_inverse(sp.prior.aa.ss,dvcij,sp.prior.aa.v);
01794             // half
01795             q[tin] /= 2;
01796             
01797             // penalize assorted peculiar features of the data
01798             // i.e. too close, too strange
01799             if (sp.hardshell==2)
01800                 q[tin] += NS*fix_shell(ldij,lcij,lhij,sp.shellbarrier);
01801             if (sp.hardshell==1)
01802                 q[tin] += NS*fix_hom_shell(ldij,lcij,lhij,sp.shellbarrier);
01803             if (sp.CSepPen>0)
01804             {
01805                 // avoid cluster splitting by ad-hoc penalty for FLD too small
01806                 // rather ad-hoc favor for having FLD large!
01807                 double flddh,fldhc,flddc;
01808                 // compute FLD for cluster separation
01809                 flddh = (ldij-lhij)*(ldij-lhij)/(dvdij+dvhij);
01810                 fldhc = (lhij-lcij)*(lhij-lcij)/(dvhij+dvcij);
01811                 flddc = (ldij-lcij)*(ldij-lcij)/(dvdij+dvcij);
01812                 // threshold FLD to avoid too much repulsion
01813                 flddh = flddh/(1+flddh/sp.CSepThr);
01814                 fldhc = fldhc/(1+fldhc/sp.CSepThr);
01815                 // might have only homs, so keep this
01816                 flddc = flddc/(1+flddc/(2*sp.CSepThr));
01817                 // apply data points at risk
01818                 flddh *= (ydij+yhij);
01819                 fldhc *= (yhij+ycij);
01820                 flddc *= (ydij+ycij);
01821                 // favor! [larger FLD better, up to a point]
01822                 q[tin] -= sp.CSepPen * (flddh+fldhc+flddc);
01823             }
01824         }
01825 
01826     
01827     qtoeq(q,ZS);
01828     // convert q to label
01829     eqtoproblabel(ec,eh,ed,ZS,q);
01830 }
01831 
01832 /**
01833  * tunes up the prior to allow for cluster shifts
01834  *
01835  */
01836 void apply_wobble(snp_param &sp)
01837 {
01838     // apply "wobble" to account for possible cluster shifts
01839     // i.e. even if infinite amount of prior data
01840     // this experimental set could be different
01841     //
01842     // // change to "f" here to preserve prior relative frequency after changing k
01843     //
01844     // note that this is currently "undone" in the actual 1-D seeding routine to preserve continuity of behavior
01845     // flag will be installed to allow better behavior
01846     
01847     double tmp;
01848     tmp = 1/sp.wobble;
01849     if (tmp<sp.prior.aa.k)
01850         sp.prior.aa.k = tmp;
01851     if (tmp<sp.prior.ab.k)
01852         sp.prior.ab.k = tmp;
01853     if (tmp<sp.prior.bb.k)
01854         sp.prior.bb.k = tmp;
01855     // note that the posterior will reflect the "lower" preknowledge
01856     // of the prior data
01857     
01858 }
01859 
01860 /*
01861  * Do QC check to see if values are weird, indicative of error
01862  *
01863  * @param call - genotype per data point
01864  * @param conf - confidence per data point
01865  * @param y - strength per data point
01866  */
01867 void qc_modify_confidences(vector<affx::GType> &call, vector<double> &conf, vector<double> &y, double perr)
01868 {
01869     // use scatter in y direction to find outlier data points
01870     // outlier = pr(under model for y)<pr(error)
01871     // assume normal distribution of residuals
01872     // assume common variance (improve power for minor cluster)
01873     // don't assume common mean
01874     int cIx, i;
01875     double tmp,num,ss;
01876     vector<double> residual;
01877     double wgt;
01878 
01879 
01880     residual.resize(y.size());
01881     for (cIx=0; cIx<3; cIx++) // valid calls
01882     {
01883         tmp = 0;
01884         num = 0.00001; // tiny
01885         for (i=0; i<call.size(); i++)
01886             if (call[i]==cIx)
01887             {
01888                 tmp += y[i];
01889                 num +=1;
01890             }
01891         tmp/=num; // now have mean
01892         for (i=0; i<call.size(); i++)
01893             if (call[i]==cIx)
01894             {
01895                 residual[i] = y[i]-tmp;
01896             }
01897     }
01898     ss = 0;
01899     for (i=0; i<residual.size(); i++)
01900         ss+= residual[i]*residual[i];
01901     ss /= residual.size(); // degrees of freedom close enough
01902     ss += 0.001; // avoid zero
01903     for (i=0; i<residual.size(); i++)
01904     {
01905         // "standardized" probability (don't care about variance)
01906         tmp = exp(-1*residual[i]*residual[i]/(2*ss))/(2.51);
01907         // generate a weight
01908         if (tmp>0)
01909             wgt = perr/tmp;
01910         else
01911             wgt = perr/(0.000001);
01912         conf[i] = (conf[i] + wgt)/(1+wgt); // perr = "relative likelihood of error"
01913     }
01914 }
01915 
01916 void qc_compute_copy_posterior(vector<affx::GType> call, vector<double> &y, snp_distribution &posterior)
01917 {
01918     vector<double> cmean;
01919     vector<double> cnum;
01920     vector<double> residual;
01921     double shrinkage = 0.00001;
01922     double vshrinkage = 0.1;
01923     double minvar = 0.1;
01924     int cIx, i;
01925     double cy,ss;
01926     
01927     // old_style computation
01928     residual.resize(call.size());
01929     cmean.resize(3);
01930     cnum.resize(3);
01931     
01932     for (cIx=0; cIx<3; cIx++)
01933     {
01934         cmean[cIx] = 0;
01935         cnum[cIx] = 0;
01936         for (i=0; i<call.size(); i++)
01937         {
01938             if (call[i]==cIx)
01939             {
01940                 cmean[cIx] += y[i];
01941                 cnum[cIx] +=1;
01942             }
01943         }
01944     }
01945     cy = (cmean[0] + cmean[1] + cmean[2])/(cnum[0]+cnum[1]+cnum[2]);
01946     
01947     // shrink towards common mean to fill in nonexistent calls
01948     cmean[0] = (cy*shrinkage+cmean[0])/(cnum[0]+shrinkage);
01949     cmean[1] = (cy*shrinkage+cmean[1])/(cnum[1]+shrinkage);
01950     cmean[2] = (cy*shrinkage+cmean[2])/(cnum[2]+shrinkage);
01951     // all three exist
01952     for (i=0; i<call.size(); i++)
01953     {
01954         // if (call[i]>-1 && call[i]<3) {
01955     if (affx::GType_called(call[i])) { // aa,ab,bb
01956             residual[i] = y[i] - cmean[call[i]];
01957         }
01958         else {
01959             residual[i] = 0.0;
01960     }
01961     }
01962     ss = 0;
01963     for (i=0; i<residual.size(); i++)
01964         ss+= residual[i]*residual[i];
01965     ss = (ss + minvar*vshrinkage)/(residual.size()+vshrinkage); // degrees of freedom close enough for large data sets
01966 
01967     // output means (shrunk towards center)
01968     posterior.aa.ym = cmean[0];
01969     posterior.ab.ym = cmean[1];
01970     posterior.bb.ym = cmean[2];
01971     // output common variance
01972     posterior.aa.yss = ss;
01973     posterior.ab.yss = ss;
01974     posterior.bb.yss = ss;
01975 }
01976 
01977 
01978 /*
01979  * Do QC check to see if values are weird, indicative of error
01980  *
01981  * @param call - genotype per data point
01982  * @param conf - confidence per data point
01983  * @param y - strength per data point
01984  */
01985 void qc_posterior_modify_confidences(vector<affx::GType> &call, vector<double> &conf, vector<double> &y, double perr, snp_distribution dist)
01986 {
01987     // use scatter in y direction to find outlier data points
01988     // outlier = pr(under model for y)<pr(error)
01989     // assume normal distribution of residuals
01990     // assume common variance (improve power for minor cluster)
01991     // don't assume common mean
01992     int cIx, i;
01993     double tmp;
01994   // double num,ss;
01995     double residual;
01996     vector<double> cmean,cvar;
01997     double wgt;
01998 
01999     cmean.resize(3);
02000     cvar.resize(3);
02001     cmean[0] = dist.aa.ym;
02002     cmean[1] = dist.ab.ym;
02003     cmean[2] = dist.bb.ym;
02004 
02005     cvar[0] = dist.aa.yss;
02006     cvar[1] = dist.ab.yss;
02007     cvar[2] = dist.bb.yss;
02008     
02009     for (cIx=0; cIx<3; cIx++) // valid calls
02010     {
02011         for (i=0; i<call.size(); i++)
02012             if (call[i]==cIx)
02013             {
02014                 residual = y[i]-cmean[cIx];
02015                 tmp = exp(-1*residual*residual/(2*cvar[cIx]))/(2.51);
02016                 // generate a weight
02017                 if (tmp>0)
02018                 {
02019                     wgt = perr/tmp;
02020                     conf[i] = (conf[i] + wgt)/(1+wgt); // perr = "relative likelihood of error"
02021                 }
02022                 else
02023                     conf[i] = 1;            
02024             }
02025     }
02026 }
02027 
02028 /**
02029  * Set up the binned data from the regular data
02030  * compute running sums, allocate sorted bins
02031  *
02032  * @param zall - overall structure to keep track of data + soft genotype labels by bin
02033  * @param x    - initial data points (unsorted)
02034  * @param genohints - hints associated with data points
02035  * @param numbins - how many bins to make, if bins>points, go with points
02036  *
02037  */
02038 void initialize_bins(binned_data &zall, vector<double> &x, vector<double> &y, vector<int> &genohints, vector<double> &SubsetInbred, int numbins, int hok, double CP)
02039 {
02040     int i;
02041 
02042     // takes a sorted vector of length z and labels it
02043     // this will be different when using bins
02044 
02045 
02046 
02047     // call sides "d" and "c" to avoid genotype confusion
02048     // negative genotypes are "d", positive are "c", middle are "h"
02049 
02050     // divide sorted points into bins by z
02051     // division by range(points)/(bins+1)
02052     // if bins==0, no change in behavior, exactly 1 point/bin
02053     // min 1 point per bin (nz)
02054     // sum(z) in zz
02055     // sum(z^2) in zzx
02056     // count the bins
02057     //     
02058     zall.length = x.size();
02059     zall.NS = zall.length+1;
02060     
02061     vector<double> z,w;
02062     vector<int> zerohints;
02063     vector<double> zeroInbred;
02064     // local hints always null unless assigned otherwise
02065     zerohints.assign(zall.length,-1);
02066     zeroInbred.assign(zall.length,0);
02067     /// store sorted data
02068     z.resize(zall.length);
02069     w.resize(zall.length); // y values stored in sorted x order
02070     ///
02071     zall.nz.resize(zall.NS);
02072     zall.zz.resize(zall.NS);
02073     zall.zzx.resize(zall.NS);
02074     // y terms
02075     zall.zy.resize(zall.NS);
02076     zall.zzy.resize(zall.NS);
02077     zall.zxy.resize(zall.NS);
02078     // hints
02079     zall.nod.resize(zall.NS);
02080     zall.noh.resize(zall.NS);
02081     zall.noc.resize(zall.NS);
02082 
02083     vector< pair<int,double> > data;
02084 
02085     for (i=0; i<zall.length; i++)
02086     {
02087         pair<int,double> p;
02088         /*
02089         if (genohints.size()>0)
02090             p.first = genohints[i];
02091         else
02092             p.first = -1; // no hint here */
02093         p.first = i; // keep index
02094         p.second = x[i];
02095         data.push_back(p);
02096     }
02097 
02098     // sort the data keeping the index to refer to others
02099     sort(data.begin(),data.end(),second_less());
02100 
02101     for (i=0; i<zall.length; i++)
02102     {
02103         z[i] = x[data[i].first];
02104         w[i] = y[data[i].first];
02105         if (genohints.size()>0)
02106             zerohints[i] = genohints.at(data[i].first);
02107         else
02108             zerohints[i] = -1; //no hint here
02109         if (SubsetInbred.size()>0)
02110             zeroInbred[i] = SubsetInbred.at(data[i].first);
02111     }
02112     zall.ZS = setup_bins(zall,z,w,zerohints, zeroInbred, zall.length,numbins,hok,CP);
02113     zall.ec.resize(zall.ZS);
02114     zall.ed.resize(zall.ZS);
02115     zall.eh.resize(zall.ZS);    
02116 }
02117 
02118 
02119 /**
02120  * The master routine: takes data and turns it into genotypes with no seeds needed
02121  *
02122  * @param call - output of genotypes per data point
02123  * @param conf - output of confidences (1-relative probability)
02124  * @param x    - contrast values per data point
02125  * @param y     - size values per data point - used as QC check for copy number
02126  * @param genohints - any reference genotypes you have lying around as hints
02127  * @param sp - snp parameters: prior information, algorithm parameters, etc.
02128  */
02129 void bayes_label(vector<affx::GType> &call, 
02130                  vector<double> &conf, 
02131                  vector<double> &x, 
02132                  vector<double> &y, 
02133                  vector<int> &genohints, 
02134                  vector<double> &SubsetInbred, 
02135                  snp_param &sp)
02136 {
02137   vector<double> ted,teh,tec;
02138   bayes_label(call, conf, x, y, genohints, SubsetInbred, sp, ted, teh, tec, false);
02139 }
02140 void bayes_label(vector<affx::GType> &call, 
02141                  vector<double> &conf, 
02142                  vector<double> &x, 
02143                  vector<double> &y, 
02144                  vector<int> &genohints, 
02145                  vector<double> &SubsetInbred, 
02146                  snp_param &sp, 
02147                  vector<double> &ted,
02148                  vector<double> &teh,
02149                  vector<double> &tec, 
02150                  bool store_probabilities)
02151 {
02152     binned_data zall;
02153 
02154     // set up posterior in case no processing of data ("single sample mode")
02155     sp.priortoposterior();
02156     // weaken prior if cluster shifting expected
02157     apply_wobble(sp);
02158 
02159     // if we're not running single-sample mode
02160     // we want to fit the binned data
02161     if (sp.callmethod<2)
02162     {
02163         // format the data & hints into bins
02164         initialize_bins(zall, x, y, genohints, SubsetInbred, sp.bins,sp.hok,sp.contradictionpenalty);
02165 
02166         // take the setup-bins, integrate over all possible labelings
02167         // computing the relative likelihood of the data    
02168         integratebrlmmoverlabelings(zall.ec,zall.eh,zall.ed,zall.ZS,zall,sp);
02169 
02170         // take the estimated mixture fraction of labels
02171         // turn into approximate "posterior" distribution 
02172         if (sp.clustertype==1)
02173             labelstoposterior(zall.ec,zall.eh,zall.ed,zall.ZS,zall,sp);
02174         else
02175             labels_two_posterior(zall.ec,zall.eh,zall.ed,zall.ZS,zall,sp);
02176     }
02177     // make calls based on mean/variance/confidence
02178     // x >unsorted< matrix of calls
02179     if (sp.callmethod>0)
02180     {
02181         if (store_probabilities) {
02182             ted.resize(x.size());
02183             teh.resize(x.size());
02184             tec.resize(x.size());
02185         }
02186         // make calls only by posterior distribution
02187         if (sp.clustertype==1)
02188             make_calls(call,conf,x,x.size(),sp.posterior.aa, sp.posterior.ab, sp.posterior.bb, sp.copynumber,sp.mix,ted,teh,tec,store_probabilities);
02189         else
02190             make_two_calls(call,conf,x,y,x.size(),sp.posterior, sp.copynumber,sp.mix,sp.ocean,sp.inflatePRA,ted,teh,tec, store_probabilities);
02191     }
02192     else
02193     {
02194         // output the raw labels matched to data points
02195         ted.resize(zall.length);
02196         tec.resize(zall.length);
02197         teh.resize(zall.length);
02198         // expand data from bins into 1-1 data (still sorted)
02199         expand_data(ted,zall.length,zall.ed,zall.nz,zall.ZS);
02200         expand_data(tec,zall.length,zall.ec,zall.nz,zall.ZS);
02201         expand_data(teh,zall.length,zall.eh,zall.nz,zall.ZS);
02202         // make calls by expanded data (unsorting)
02203         make_label_calls(call,conf,x,x.size(),ted,tec,teh,sp.copynumber);
02204         if (!store_probabilities) {
02205             ted.clear();
02206             teh.clear();
02207             tec.clear();
02208         }
02209     }
02210     // do copy number QC test
02211     // only if not running in single-sample mode
02212     if (sp.copytype==0)
02213     {
02214         if (sp.copyqc>0 && sp.callmethod<2)
02215         {
02216             qc_modify_confidences(call,conf,y,sp.copyqc);
02217         }
02218     }
02219     // new style copyqc
02220     // uses prior information if single-sample mode to modify confidence
02221     // Note possible low confidence for unobserved clusters!!!
02222     // must have 2-dimensional clusters stored/allowed
02223     if (sp.copytype==1)
02224     {
02225         if (sp.copyqc>0)
02226         {
02227             // do not compute posterior if single-sample mode
02228             if (sp.callmethod<2)
02229                 qc_compute_copy_posterior(call,y,sp.posterior);
02230             // modify confidences if either mode
02231             qc_posterior_modify_confidences(call,conf,y,sp.copyqc,sp.posterior);
02232         }
02233     }
02234 }
